description.narrative: Energy - policy, planning and administration
Mechanisms for payment for ecosystem services ES are tested and replication systems developed to ensure the protection of natural ecosystems of Argentina and the services provided by these
1Number of schemes and hectares under PES schemes in pilot areas

comment.narrative: No PES under implementation with differential payment reflecting amounts of ES provided
By end of project 4 PES schemes covering 145000 hectares

Four PES schemes for Chaco Formosa Entre Rios and Misiones have been designed and under different levels of implementation Total area covered by the four PES schemes is 85000 ha after correcting area in Misiones pilot site

description.narrative:
2 Number of hectares identified with conditions for replication upon project termination
a In pilot provinces
b Outside project area

comment.narrative: a In pilot Provinces Chaco 45 million ha of forests Formosa 35 million ha of forests Entre Rios 25 million ha with high erosion risk Jujuy TbD upon Project start up b Outside Project area 45 million hectares

In Chaco the provincial government has adopted the Projects technical guidelines to design forest management plans Disposición Nro 17215 as the base for applying the PES scheme to about 45 millón ha of forests categorized under the National Forest Protection Law In Formosa the Project has the commitment of the governamental authorities to replicate Projects lessons in its jurisdiction about 35 million ha of forests In Entre Ríos a bill to incorporate payment for carbon and biodiversity ES into the Provincial Conservation Law has been presented to the local Legislature covering about 2 million ha of soil under erosion risk In Misiones the Project has the commitment from the provincial government and several Watershed Committees about 60000 ha to replicate Projects lessons and snd PES design
Outside Pilot Areas i activities regarding development of Forest Conservation Indicators and Forest Management Plans have been initiated wint the province of La Pampa with a replication potencial in 25 millon ha of Calden forest ii The Project is participating into the SAyDS Program on Forest Managenment with Integrated Livestock PFMIL The PFMIL will be applied to about 12 million ha of forest in the Northern part of the country iii activities to replicate Projectlessons have been carried out capacitation workshops on SE and PES with two Watershed Committees in Misiones Province Jabotí and Tabay covering about 60000 ha

description.narrative: 3 increase in the composition of representative communities andor functional groups of the ecosystems in projects intervention area

comment.narrative: Information available at regional areas

Herbaceous and shrub species 10 and ground cover 15 tree seedlings 5 in species and 5 in abundance pollinating insects 10 in families predatory arthropods 10 in families birds 10 in species 5 for raptors and 5 for insectivores

Biodiversity baselines in the four Pilot Sites are completed Composition and abundance of different taxonomic groups ie vegetation mammals bats and birds have been established for the most representative ecological habitatscommunities in the four Pilot Sites Information from baseline will be used to estimate increase in the composition of representative communitiesfunctional groups at the end of Project after ES providers have made land use changes and adopted Projects prescribed conservation practices

comment.narrative: Nonexistent
By PY4 at least 10 regional workshops with at least 50 participants per workshop

There have been eight large workshops on ES and PES schemes Chaco 3 Misiones 2 Entre Ríos 2 and Formosa 1 with a total of about 400 participants including landowners policymakers researchers and technical staff from the national and provincial governments There has been also numerous about 25 presentationsradio showsmeetingsconferences about Project objectives and activities directed to a wide range of audiences ie farmers general public researchers policymakers at the local regional national and international level during the reporting period In addition a paper describing the Project experience developing the PES scheme associated with the Forest Conservation Law 26331 in the Chaco Pilot Site has been accepted for publication in the XIV World Forestry Congress to be held in South Africa in September 2015

Contacts are maintained with the Chairman of the Agricutural Comission of the National Congress to pursue the idea of a proposal on a PES national law based on project s lessons

description.narrative: 4 Number of potential hectares identified where PES schemes may be applied

comment.narrative: Nonexistent
By PY4 45 million hectares

Number of hectares where PES schemes guidelines developed by the project are in the process of upscaling 7 million Chaco 45 million Entre Ríos 25 million Number of potential hectares where PES scheme in provinces with pilot sites could be applied i Misiones 600000 hectares ii Formosa 35 million hectares

description.narrative: Knowhow on effective operational setups for optimizing benefits from existing and potential ES incentives is expanded and reinforced through field demonstrations of different PES schemes
1PES schemes and monitoring mechanisms designed and validated with provincial authorities and local stakeholders

comment.narrative: Existing incentives lack specific mechanisms to implement PES schemes that secure global benefits
By PY1 3 PES schemes under Government incentives Chaco Formosa and Entre Rios and 1 classical PES scheme Jujuy

Four PES schemes are under different stages of implementation in the four pilot sites In Entre Rios all technical and operative aspects for the PES scheme have been completed and jointly developed with provincial authorities The provincial government who is in charge of executing the PES decided that before proceeding to make any compensation under the new compensation scheme it will incorporate the compensation for carbon and biodiversity ES conservation into the body of the Provincial Soil Conservation Law a bill proposal in that direction is currently under discussion in the provincial Legislature In addition 30 farmers are preparing systematization plans for their farms under the Projects approach In Misiones all aspects regarding institutional and administrative arrangements ie contracts administration of funds monitoring and certification of land use plans etc needed to put into place the PES scheme have been completed and validated with key actors such as the Cooperativa de Servicios de Oberá in charge of collecting and disbursing the payments the Municipalities of Oberá and Campo Ramón where beneficiaries are located and the San Ramón Watershed Committee the overseeing institution Although farmers located in critical areas for water services are being capacitated for developing management plans to receive the payment the Cooperative of Oberá has requested to postpone for 2016 the application of the PES scheme in order to adjust water tariffs water tariffs need to be adjusted by 40 to be according to inflation a provision costs before including a charge for ES in the water bill In Chaco and Formosa technical and operative aspects of the PES scheme associated to the National Forest Conservation Law 26331 have been designed by the Project Amounts to be paid by ES are still under discussion among national and provincial authorities under the aegis of the project Although farmers participating in the project elaborated and presented their management plans following the Project PES scheme guidelines at the end of 2014 to receive payment under Law 26331 in 2015 27 in Chaco and 10 in Formosa no payment has been made yet due to differences between national and provincial authorities regarding funds allocation for management plans of fermers participating in the Project

More tan 75 of the substantive staff from SAyDS about 15 personnel and INTA about 40 personnel related to Project topics ie forest soils water biodiversity economics GIS management plan formulation PES design and monitoring are involved in the Poject In addition training to strengthen capacities and knowledge on ES and PES has to continue to different audiences and decisiónmakers In Chaco and Formosa 25 decisiónmakers and technical staff form the provincial government 10 researchers from de regional university and 15 professionals from the private sector were trained on forest management plan design aimed at ES conservation and on ES importance in land planning In Misiones a course on PES oriented to water services was conducted to membersof the San ramón Watershed Committee 27 participants In Entre Ríos two workshops on ES and PES design were offered to 25 personnel from INTA the provincial government and the local university

capital of a political entity

activity-description.narrative: Reducir el riesgo de las emisiones de bifenilos policlorados y la exposición de la población y el medio ambiente a dichas sustancias

description.narrative: Energy - policy, planning and administration

Reduce the risk of PCB exposure and emissions for the population and the environment by strengthening PCB environmental management systems and eliminating contaminated oil and equipment currently being used or stored so as to meet the goal of eliminating 2000 tons of PCB in an environmentally friendly manner
Tons of PCBs eliminated tons and cost per ton

comment.narrative: The latest estimate based on information from control bodies and sectoral estimates amounts to 3515 tons of PCBs contaminated oil and equipment
Report on the elimination of 2000 tons of contaminated oil and equipment by project end indicating mode of destruction used and cost per ton

During this reporting period the Project can acredit dechlorination of 175000 litres of PCBcontaminated oil with a total of 700 tons of decontaminated wastes done by the Projects cofunders
In addition during this reporting period a total of 449 tons of PCB wastes were exported for final disposal to France consisting in 315 tons of capacitors 37 tons of contaminated oils3785 tons of more than 210 transformers and 2 tons of residues
Hence the Project can prove that since its inception and until June 30 2015 Argentina has decontaminated more than 8600 tons of which 1212 tons were exported to France for final disposal and over 7450 tons were decontaminated by private operators Of this total the 22 can be directly assigned to Projects efforts or cofunder activities
It should be noted that since 2013 particularly after the entry into force of SAyDS Resolution No 52214 there has been an exponential growth in the tonnage that was disposed of through exports
Within the scope of its objectives the project was directly involved in the drafting followup approval and effective implementation of the above resolution which simplified the export process

description.narrative: Development and implementation of a national PCB final disposal and destruction strategy
PCB final disposal and destruction strategy validated by national and provincial authorities

comment.narrative: National efforts to meet the obligations of the Stockholm Convention are weakened by the lack of coordination between national and provincial environmental authorities
A feasibility study with options for treatment decontamination and final disposal of PCBs validated by stakeholders and including funding options

The Project has conducted a study on the PCB disposal capacity at a national level including the technologies available on the local market This assessment included the technologies used infrastructure territorial scope and operational costs among other variables
Additionally during this period the Project collected information on new technologies for the treatment and end disposal of PCBs being used in Latin America

description.narrative: Initial consultations with the main stakeholders and continuous communications with the public at large
Communication plan with information and consultation meetings among stakeholders on the expected Project objectives and outcomes Number of meetings held and percentage of participants

comment.narrative: Environmental enforcement authorities in the provinces the small and medium ownersholders of PCBs and the large users of the electricity sector have little information on their responsibilities within the framework of the Stockholm Convention and the national legislation for identifying and eliminating PCB stocks
Local governments trained and informed about PCB environmental management and interested in becoming a part of the Project

The Project continued to implement the communication plan having 36 meetings with the main stakeholders including PCBs owners the electrical sector environmental authorities PCBs operators among others
Since its inception and until June 2015 the Project held meetings with local authorities from 15 provinces with the purpose of informing them about actions undertaken under the Project
As previously stated the Project has entered into agreements with 5 of these provinces where they commited to undertake necessary tasks to eliminate PCBs
Please note that the absence of such an agreement does not mean that the Province is unaware of the project or is not making efforts in that direction but that it improving the management of PCBs through other means

description.narrative: Environmental management plans implemented by companies of the electrical sector generation transportation and distribution companies and large users within the provinces

comment.narrative: There is a gap between compliance with the Stockholm Convention at the federal and provincial levels
Generation and distribution companies and large users within the provinces with PCB environmental management plans and a programme for their elimination

With regard to the two pilot provinces it should be noted that the cooperatives in Entre Rios are in the final stage of the PCB decontamination efforts throughout the provincial territory A bidding process is under way to contract an operator to dechlorinate the remaining 1021 contaminated units
In the case of Formosa one cooperative is already decontaminating 49 transformers summing a total of 16 tons and the other cooperative is surveying and sampling all of its transformers more than 1500
In these two provinces the Project has provided support and fundings in all tasks such as sampling transformers and decontaminating oils and equipment
Apart from the pilot provinces the Project has relevant gathered information from key actors in the electricity sector including ATEERA the Association of transporters of electricity and Projects cofunder which has purchased its own equipment to decontaminate transformers and has been doing so since 2010
Among the major electricity generators Centrales de la Costa Atlantica Project cofunder already has PCBfree equipment also large users in 11 provinces are exporting PCBs while local distributors in 6 provinces are carrying out transformer dechlorination activities
In all these stakeholders the Project has provided technical assistance and guidelines to ensure a rational sound management disposal of PCBs

description.narrative: Strengthening of the institutional capacity of the national and provincial governments of Argentina and of large PCB ownersholders for a safe and environmentally sound management of and final disposal of PCBs
A laboratory certification programme for PCB testing implemented through INTI

comment.narrative: Percentage of labs certified for PCBs
Registro de certified labs accredited for PCB analysis

A national survey has been completed the purpose of which was to learn about the technical capacities of laboratories for PCB analyses
A technical document has been drafted containing all survey results including an assessment of the situation
Following the projects strategic decision to encourage consensusbased technical developments a workshop was held in July with 15 major laboratories and other relevant government agencies so as to submit the document for discussion and include their experience and contributions Every year between 30 and 40 labs accredit PCBs analysis capacities in the National Institute of Industrial Technology Most of them belong to Buenos Aires The Projects efforts and strategy is to have accredited at least one lab in each region or province

description.narrative: A sustainable training programme for large users from the electricity sector duly trained on PCBrelated risks and on PCB environmental management

comment.narrative: Large users of the electricity sector buildings and companies are not aware of the risks to health and the environment brought about by inappropriate PCB environmental management
Large users from the electricity sector duly trained on PCBrelated risks and on PCB environmental management

In this reporting period over 25 people from the electricity sector have been trained including authorities from electricity generation transportation and distribution companies as well as sector technicians and operators A total of 70 persons where trained since the Projects inception

description.narrative: Number of inspectors from the national environmental authority and from provincial enforcement authorities duly trained and implementing monitoring and control of PCB management

comment.narrative: There are regulations at the national level and in some provinces but no monitoring and control capacity by environmental authorities
Inspectors from the national environmental authority and from provincial enforcement authorities duly trained and implementing monitoring and control of PCB management

In this period more than 170 government agents have been trained in environmentally sound management including environmental authorities inspectors and environmental oversight officers A total of 230 persons where trained since the Projects inception

description.narrative: Reviewed and harmonized PCB legislation validated by the national and provincial governments

comment.narrative: There is a gap in policies technical guidelines institutional capacity and regulations between the national environmental authority and the provincial environmental enforcement authoritiesNonharmonization between the institutional capabilities and rules of the national and provincial environmental audits

Two provinces under the pilot project with environmental enforcement authorities that have the rules and institutional capacity to monitor and control the proper application of a PCB environmental management system

In 2014 the Project published and disseminated a compilation of regulations on PCBs at a national level and from all 24 provinces
Based on this compilation the Project is working in coordination with the Regulatory Authority of the Secretariat for Environment and Sustainable Development to develop a comparative analysis and a series of recommendations andor suggestions in order to change improve and strengthen the regulations in place

description.narrative: Temporary PCB storing sites at the local regional andor central levels duly set up and receiving technical support
Evaluación de los requerimientos para la construcción yo adecuación de depósitos temporales

comment.narrative: The possibility of storing PCB contaminated oil and equipment by small and medium sized generation and distribution companies is quite limited
Requerimientos para la construcción yo adecuación de depósitos temporales establecidos

The Project has developed a technical specifications manual for the design andor upgrading of sites used for the temporary storage of electrical transformers and PCB containers including the possibility of performing decontamination operations in order to ensure their environmentally sustainable managementThis manual was distributed to the provinces and is also available on the Projects website

description.narrative: Feasibility Studies for authorizing the operation of the temporary storing sites for PCB contaminated oil and equipment

comment.narrative: Since there are no regional storage sites it is not possible optimize PCB treatment and elimination costs
PCB regional storage sites duly established and accepted by users in the provinces for temporary storage

The Project has provided training technical resources and oversight to a temporary storing site for electrical equipment to be decontaminated in the Province of Rio Negro
In the Province of Entre Rios the project supported the adaptation of a storage site in the city of Concordia by providing materials and technical support
Also through an agreement with the Facultad de Ciencias de la Alimentacion de la Universidad de Entre Rios School of Food Science of the University of Entre Rios an additional environmental impact assessment and environmental baseline study were conducted for a site designated for decontamination of all the transformers in the province
In the Province of Formosa the Project has also helped with the adaptation of a site in the town of El Colorado where the transformers belonging to the provinces electricity distribution cooperatives will be stockpiled and decontaminated

description.narrative: Human rights affairs
Año 2016: 1) N° de Organismos de la APN y/o Gobiernos Subnacionales a los cuales se les brinda solución de hosting para la mejora de los servicios a los/as ciudadanos/as

comment.narrative: 4 organismos de la APN incorporados a la plataforma web de Guías de Trámites; transferencia del Programa Carta Compromiso con el Ciudadano a 2 provincias; 6 capacitaciones a organismos nacionales en la metodología de evaluación del PNC 8 aplicaciones interactivas en entornos sociales web para el sitio "Argentina Comparte: Ventanilla Única de Políticas Públicas Juveniles" Fortalecer las capacidades de la JGM en el Monitoreo y Evaluación de Políticas Públicas a través de la implementación de nuevas funcionalidades del sistema SISEG y nuevos tableros de comando y metodología de monitoreo aplicada a la totalidad de los programas con financiamiento externo Colaborar en la realización de eventos académicos, incorporar jóvenes investigadores conforme los lineamientos del Programa PEJI y apoyar la realización de 2 publicaciones de investigación en administración pública para fortalecer y promover Investigaciones sobre Estado, Administración Pública y Sociedad; Actualizar la infraestructura de firma digital, contratar y desarrollar la plataforma SSO, crear la plataforma de datos abiertos de gobierno.

La Plataforma web de Guías de Trámites cuyo objetivo es la creación de un espacio colaborativo de intercambio de experiencias relativas a la implementación del portal en distintos ámbitos, se encuentra desarrollada y administrada, y se ha incorporado la Subsecretaria de Coordinación y Gestión Pública de la Provincia de Chaco. El proceso de adecuación y actualización del Módulo de Administración de la Guía de Trámites está en proceso. Se realizó una "Evaluación de Usabilidad de la Guía de Trámites". Durante 2015 se realizó la transferencia del programa a la provincia de Entre Ríos y la Provincia de San Juan. Además se firmaron 11 Cartas Compromiso con el Ciudadano: 2 son primeras Cartas y 9 re-implementaciones (Autoridad Regulatoria Nuclear – ARN- 2ª Carta; Dirección de Catastro de Tucumán -2ª Carta-; Dirección Nacional de Migraciones - DMN -5ª Carta-; Dirección Nacional de Migraciones, Delegación Mar del Plata -1ª Carta-; Ente Nacional de Regulación de la Electricidad -4ª Carta; Instituto Nacional Central Único Coordinador de Ablación e Implante -3ª Carta-; Instituto Nacional contra la Discriminación, la Xenofobia y el Racismo –3ª Carta-; Municipio de Lanús -2ª Carta-; Registro Nacional de Aeronaves -2ª Carta-; Servicio Nacional de Rehabilitación - 3ª Carta-; Trenes Argentinos Operadora Ferroviaria -1ª Carta-). Se capacitaron a 6 organismos aspirantes al Premio Nacional a la Calidad durante 2015 (los nombres no se consignan por normativa del Premio). Se realizó el Taller de Evaluadores 2015 con el fin de conformar la Junta de Evaluadores del Premio Nacional a la Calidad para el Sector público de este año. Se diseñaron e implementaron 18 micrositios web que están disponibles en la página Argentina Comparte. El Tablero de Metas Ministeriales se implantó en 19 organismos. El SISEG tiene en funcionamiento pleno ocho tableros en diversas dependencias de la JGM, desarrollados a medida de las necesidades de varias oficinas de la Secretaría de Gabinete. se presen
